subject: Personal Finance
title: Exchange Rates
description: A quick win: understand Exchange Rates.

hook.text: Your dollar buys 150 yen but only 0.9 euros. Exchange rates make the same money worth different things abroad.

buildup.text: Exchange rates are the price of one currency in terms of another. They shift constantly.

discovery.text: Rates are driven by interest rates, trade balances, inflation, and investor confidence in each country.

twist.text: A strong dollar makes imports cheap but exports expensive. Countries sometimes want weaker currencies.

climax.text: Currency wars â€” where countries devalue to boost exports â€” can destabilize the entire global economy.

punchline.text: Currency values shape global winners and losers.

quiz.question: Why might a country want a weaker currency?
options: To make its exports cheaper for foreign buyers
